The defendant will be eligible for early release on grounds of his industry and good conduct during his three years and five months in custody, but subject to the prison...

title: RBI Monetary Policy Committee keeps repo rate unchanged at 5.50%
summary: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), chaired by Governor Sanjay Malhotra, met from August 4 to August 6, 2025, for its third bi-monthly monetary policy review of the financial year 2025–26.
fullContent: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), chaired by Governor Sanjay Malhotra, met from August 4 to August 6, 2025, for its third bi-monthly monetary policy review of the financial year 2025–26. The committee decided to keep the repo rate unchanged at 5.50 percent, pausing after three consecutive rate cuts earlier this year.

title: RBI Monetary Policy Committee keeps repo rate unchanged at 5.50%
summary: The RBI on Wednesday kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.50 percent after its August 4–6 policy meeting, pausing after three cuts this year. Despite rising trade risks from new US tariffs, the MPC retained its FY26 GDP forecast to 6.5 percent and lowered inflation to 3.1 percent.
fullContent: The RBI on Wednesday kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.50 percent after its August 4–6 policy meeting, pausing after three cuts this year. Despite rising trade risks from new US tariffs, the MPC retained its FY26 GDP forecast to 6.5 percent and lowered inflation to 3.1 percent.

title: NSDL shares list at 10% premium over issue price
summary: NSDL shares debuted on the stock exchanges on August 6, achieving a premium over the IPO price of Rs 800. The Rs 4,012 crore IPO witnessed substantial oversubscription, particularly from QIBs. NSDL, a key player in India's dematerialized securities market, reported revenue and...
fullContent: NSDL shares debuted on the stock exchanges on August 6, achieving a premium over the IPO price of Rs 800. The Rs 4,012 crore IPO witnessed substantial oversubscription, particularly from QIBs. NSDL, a key player in India's dematerialized securities market, reported revenue and profit growth in FY25, attracting long-term investors due to its institutional importance and dividend history.

summary: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty50 opened flat as investors anticipate the RBI's policy announcement. Expectations are for unchanged rates and a dovish stance due to rising external risks, including proposed U.S. tariffs.
fullContent: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty50 opened flat as investors anticipate the RBI's policy announcement. Expectations are for unchanged rates and a dovish stance due to rising external risks, including proposed U.S. tariffs. Bharti Airtel and Adani Ports saw gains, while Sun Pharma and Infosys traded lower.

title: Sensex falls over 200 pts, Nifty below 24,600 after RBI keeps rates steady amid tariff uncertainty
summary: Indian benchmark indices experienced a flat trade on Wednesday as the RBI maintained the repo rate at 5.5%. Market sentiment was further dampened by concerns over potential US tariffs on Indian goods, particularly pharmaceuticals, following President Trump's statements.
fullContent: Indian benchmark indices experienced a flat trade on Wednesday as the RBI maintained the repo rate at 5.5%. Market sentiment was further dampened by concerns over potential US tariffs on Indian goods, particularly pharmaceuticals, following President Trump's statements. Global markets also showed weakness due to concerns about the impact of tariffs on economic activity.

title: At multi-year highs! JK Cement and 6 other stocks witness 5-year swing high breakouts
